title: 103_s1345
content: The Equity in Educational Land Grant Status Act of 1993 may be cited as the short title. Definitions are provided in Section 2. The term "Institute" in this Act refers to the American Indian and Alaska Native Culture and Arts Development established under section 1504 of the American Indian, Alaska Native, and Native Hawaiian Culture and Art Development Act. It also includes tribally controlled community colleges as defined in the Tribal Controlled Community College Assistance Act of 1978. The Tribal Controlled Community College Assistance Act of 1978 defines tribally controlled post-secondary vocational institutions. The term "tribally controlled post-secondary vocational institutions" is defined in section 390(2) of the Tribal Controlled Vocational Institutions Support Act of 1990. The Tribal Controlled Community College Assistance Act of 1978 grants status to tribally controlled community colleges and post-secondary vocational institutions. The Tribal Controlled Community College Assistance Act of 1978 establishes land-grant colleges for agriculture and mechanical arts in accordance with the provisions of the Act of July 2, 1862. Any provision of an Act of Congress relating to the operation or provision of assistance to a land-grant college in the United States, Puerto Rico, or the District of Columbia is applicable. The Tribal Controlled Community College Assistance Act of 1978 extends provisions of the Act of July 2, 1862 regarding land-grant colleges in the United States, Puerto Rico, and other territories. Authorization for appropriations is provided for the endowment and maintenance of these colleges. The Act of July 2, 1862, as amended, authorizes appropriations of $10,000,000 for tribal colleges and institutions for the benefit of agriculture and the mechanic arts. Amounts appropriated under this section are considered grants to these colleges and institutions subject to the provisions of that Act applicable to the proceeds from the sale of land or land script. The Equity in Educational Land-Grant Status Act of 1993 may be cited as the Act. It defines the term "Equity in Educational Land-Grant Status Act of 1993". The term "1994 Institutions" in the Act refers to a list of colleges including Bay Mills Community College, Blackfeet Community College, Cheyenne River Community College, D-Q University, and others. (19) Standing Rock College, (20) Stonechild Community College, (21) Turtle Mountain Community College, (22) Navajo Community College, (23) United Tribes Technical College, (24) Southwest Indian Polytechnic Institute, (25) Institute of American Indian and Alaska Native Culture and Arts Development, (26) Crownpoint Institute of Technology, (27) Haskell Indian Junior College, (28) Leech Lake Tribal College, and (29) College of the Menominee Nation are some of the colleges listed in the Act. SEC. 3. LAND-GRANT STATUS FOR 1994 INSTITUTIONS. SEC. 3. LAND-GRANT STATUS FOR 1994 INSTITUTIONS. 1994 Institutions are considered land-grant colleges established for agriculture and mechanic arts under the Act of July 2, 1862. Provisions of Acts of Congress related to land-grant colleges apply to 1994 Institutions, with exceptions for certain agricultural research funding Acts. In lieu of extending provisions of the Act of July 2, 1862, $23,000,000 is authorized to be appropriated to 1994 Institutions for agricultural research. Amounts granted shall be subject to provisions applicable to proceeds from land sales. SEC. 4. APPROPRIATIONS. The Act of August 30, 1890 and the Act of May 8, 1914 are amended to include provisions for 1994 Institutions, with specific instructions on funding allocation. The Act of May 8, 1914 is amended to authorize appropriations for 1994 Institutions, with $5,000,000 allocated for fiscal year 1995 and subsequent years. The funds will be distributed through a competitive application process to State institutions established under the Act of July 2, 1862. The Act of July 2, 1862 authorizes institutions to administer funds through cooperative agreements with 1994 Institutions. Subsection (f) states no matching requirement for funds under subsection (b)(3). SEC. 5. RESEARCH FACILITIES. The Research Facilities Act (7 U.S.C. 390 et seq.) is amended to assist 1994 Institutions in constructing, acquiring, and remodeling buildings and facilities for research in agriculture and sciences through matching grants. $1,700,000 is authorized for grants each fiscal year from 1995 to 1999. For fiscal years 1995 through 1999, $1,700,000 is authorized for grants to 1994 Institutions for research facilities in agriculture and sciences. The title is amended to read: "A bill to provide land-grant status for certain Indian colleges and institutions."
